title: More efficient disk sorting is expected when there is a border value for row count
OB: When sorting on disk, if sorting on a dataset with 40000 rows and setting the program to process less than 40000 rows of data, the current behavior is as follows:
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a dataset with 40000 rows of data.
2. Set the program to process only a subset of the data, e.g., less than 40000 rows.
3. Sort the data on disk.
4. Observe the file-saving process:
   a. Save the file as a temporary file.
   b. Load the file into memory.
   c. Sort the data.
   d. Save the sorted data to the temporary file.
   e. (Missing information - please provide)
